channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Constant fly tipping (years), 20th June
item.description:
Hi The amount of fly tipping at the bottom of Wernbrook Street is insane. Currently we have a double bed an ENORMOUS bean bag and lots of other rubbish. If the council kindly pick it up, I guarantee a load more will be dumped shortly afterwards. Is there nothing we can do about it? Could you set up a camera, for example? It's been going on for years. We're all sick of it. Best wishes, Peter

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wernbrook Street, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bollard knocked over again, 20th June
item.description:
Bollard knocked over. This is the second time and it was only installed a couple of months ago. It needs a longer post and buried deeper.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Palewell Close, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Vehicle, 20th June
item.description:
Been parked badly in the same spot for 6 months and never been moved since. MOT expired 29th December 2024 and has been SORN’ed. This is a public parking spot and thus cannot be SORN’ed. Furthermore previously on multiple occasions the same owner of the vehicle has left abandoned vehicles in the same area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alnwick Road, Horn Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead pigeon on the stairs, 20th June
item.description:
I came home to find a dead pigeon on the stairs in the block of flats 21-27 brimpsfield close, it looks very nasty, we need a professional to come and pick this dead animal up asap, this is a health and safety issue, there are pigeons everywhere on the block and frequently fly into my windows as well as sitting on my window sills

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21-27, Brimpsfield Close, Abbey Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Long dry grass too close to wooden fence and house, 20th June
item.description:
Could you please cut the long dry grass just bordering 12 Florence road. The grass is a fire hazard now as it is very long and dry. We are concerned for out property. I appreciate letting grass grow for bees but the grass that needs cutting is just on other side of our fence. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Florence Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned bike, 20th June
item.description:
Literally 20 m away from the last abandoned scooter that I reported is a bike blocking exactly the same pavement. This means, but if somehow a blind person or someone in a wheelchair managed to circumnavigate the scooter that was blocking the entire pavement. They would’ve been stopped in their tracks again impossible to move on because they would now be blocked behind and in front by the kind of selfish moron that hires these abandon anywhere bikes they are a blight on society and not in the best interest of the London public. A selfish scheme for the selfish few abolish them immediately.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64, Stamford Street, Waterloo, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish all over the street outside the door, 20th June
item.description:
The tenant at Flat 1, 1 Mill Row, London, N1 5RL has dumped their rubbish downstairs (our designated collection point is less than 6 metres away yet they couldn’t be bothered to take it there). The bags have been ripped open and the trash is all over

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kingsland Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned scooter, 20th June
item.description:
Illustrative of the selfish nature of the Lime business concept and the type of people that hire these bikes and scooters here is a scooter that has been abandoned across the entire pavement rather than in the scooter Bay literally a dip down on the pavement where the scooter is positioned this scheme needs to be abolished for the betterment of the whole of pedestrian London this is abysmal. Being a significantly better member of society than the person there I call them that because they are not worthy of the term, I physically manhandled the extremely heavy scooter out the way for the benefit of the blind and otherwise mobility disabled.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Duchy Street, Waterloo, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 1 brown bin 1 blue bin used for fly tipping, 20th June
item.description:
These are abandoned bins being used for rubbish the bins and rubbish need to be permanently removed. They encourage fly tipping and a sign and camera should be used in its place as a deterrent.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stopes Street, Peckham, London

item.title: Tree planting request, 20th June
item.description:
Please plant some trees on Wickham Road, there are none and this road would benefit from greenery to look better but also to soften the noise from speeding cars. It is needed all down the road but particularly requesting for some by BR3 6LT
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wickham Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
